intro: Tragia praetervisa, commonly known as the common tragia, is an annual herbaceous plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its hairy stems and alternate leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are typically clustered in dense inflorescences. Its fruit is a capsule that splits open to release tiny, wind-dispersed seeds. Tragia praetervisa is often found in disturbed habitats such as roadsides and open fields.
